To wear a rock-shell plate, players must have at least 40 Defence and have The Fremennik Trials quest completed. The plate can be considered as a second alternative to the rune platebody, as completing the Dragon Slayer I quest isn't a requirement to wear the rock-shell plate. Item ID6129

The rock-shell plate is a piece of melee armour with stats almost identical to the rune platebody. To wear a rock-shell plate, players must have at least 40 Defence and have The Fremennik Trials quest completed. The plate can be considered as a second alternative to the rune platebody, as completing the Dragon Slayer I quest isn't a requirement to wear the rock-shell plate. The rock-shell plate also has a slightly better range attack bonus than the rune platebody and does not interfere with the affects of Ava's device so it may be viable for a range tank setup.

To obtain a rock-shell plate, players can either bring 3 dagannoth hides, 1 rock-shell shard, and 10,000 coins to Skulgrimen in Rellekka, or receive it as a drop from Dagannoth Rex.

This body can be stored in the armour case of a costume room, as part of the rock-shell armour set. Ultimate Ironmen will be unable to retrieve individual pieces until the full set is stored.

[[File:Rock-shell plate detail.png|left|130px]]
The '''rock-shell plate''' is a piece of melee armour with stats almost identical to the [[rune platebody]]. To wear a rock-shell plate, players must have at least 40 Defence and have [[The Fremennik Trials]] quest completed. The plate can be considered as a second alternative to the [[rune platebody]], as completing the [[Dragon Slayer I]] quest isn't a requirement to wear the rock-shell plate. The rock-shell plate also has a slightly better range attack bonus than the rune platebody and does not interfere with the affects of [[Ava%27s device]] so it may be viable for a range tank setup.

To obtain a rock-shell plate, players can either bring 3 [[dagannoth hide]]s, 1 [[rock-shell shard]], and 10,000 coins to [[Skulgrimen]] in [[Rellekka]], or receive it as a drop from [[Dagannoth Rex]].

This body can be stored in the [[Armour case space|armour case]] of a [[costume room]], as part of the [[rock-shell armour]] set. [[Ultimate Ironmen]] will be unable to retrieve individual pieces until the full set is stored.
